body_html:
Is there is a GitHub Gist, or something along those lines, that has up-to-date instructions for installing pytorch with GPU support on Windows (albeit experimental)?

I've been checking this issue every now and then, and it is hard to tell if:

conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch

is still the way to go, since it looks like there have been many accepted pull requests into master from @peterjc123 's fork.
body_text:
Is there is a GitHub Gist, or something along those lines, that has up-to-date instructions for installing pytorch with GPU support on Windows (albeit experimental)?
I've been checking this issue every now and then, and it is hard to tell if:
conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch
is still the way to go, since it looks like there have been many accepted pull requests into master from @peterjc123 's fork.
body:
Is there is a GitHub Gist, or something along those lines, that has up-to-date instructions for installing pytorch with GPU support on Windows (albeit experimental)? 

I've been checking this issue every now and then, and it is hard to tell if:

```shell
conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch
```
is still the way to go, since it looks like there have been many accepted pull requests into master from @peterjc123 's fork.
